page.title: 14LOCAL INDUSTRY
page.content: Mr. David Lee coppices Chestnut in Cognor Wood, which he splits, sharpens and bundles for fencing manufactured by Homewoods in Haslemere. In the heart of woodland at the top of Haste Hill there is an industrial estate of 21 Nissen huts converted from a wartime naval research establishment. Here Messrs Dolmetsch make recorders, exported all over the world, and other firms are engaged in fabricating plastics, building light engines and in electronics such as making printed circuit boards. Until l980 Jesse Manns operated a large sawmill for converting timber. Now they only prepare wood for retail in conjunction with their new large do-it-yourself store.
